title: At this point, what is your general perception towards 'radiologic technology' in the field of health care? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think that radiology is the Sherlock Holmes of medicine. Doctors will not give you an answer to any thing wrong with you until a X-Ray is taken. And I think that makes we as radiological techs the top of medical health care team. But that's just 46 years of x Ray and hospital experience talking. We are life savers and medical frontier breakers, the most important service in the hospital, because the first thing the patient asks after a x Ray is,what's wrong with me?
It’s the technology that is used to make sure that radiation therapy is accurately targeted on tumours. I still have two tattooed dots that were used to target my X-ray treatments.
